author: archyde
title: Islamic Resistance in Lebanon: Martyr Fadi Mahmoud Dhawi on the Road to Jerusalem ‚Äì Latest Updates & Operations
text:
2024-03-07 17:09:16
A new martyr for the Islamic resistance in Lebanon rises in southern Lebanon on the road to Jerusalem.
-
The martyr, the Mujahid on the road to Jerusalem, Fadi Mahmoud Dhawi (War Media of the Islamic Resistance)
Today, Thursday, the Islamic Resistance in Lebanon ‚Äì Hezbollah mourned the Mujahid Fadi Mahmoud Dhawi as a martyr on the road to Jerusalem. The military media statement stated that the martyr was born in 1976 and from the town of Aitaroun in southern Lebanon.
Before the resistance mourned its martyr, ‚ÄúJihad,‚Äù it announced that it had targeted the ‚ÄúRadar‚Äù site in the occupied Lebanese Shebaa Farms, and the ‚ÄúRuwaisat Al-Alam‚Äù site in the occupied Lebanese Kfar Shuba hills, with missile weapons, confirming that it had achieved direct hits in the two Israeli sites.
In an air attack with two attack drones, the resistance claimed responsibility for targeting the ‚ÄúMaale Golan‚Äù barracks, and announced that its fighters were targeting the locations where the occupation soldiers were stationed in the ‚ÄúAl-Matula‚Äù settlement, killing and wounding its members.
The resistance indicated that the targeting of ‚ÄúMa‚Äôali Golan‚Äù, in addition to the targeting of ‚ÄúAl-Matula‚Äù, came in support of the steadfast Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip, in support of their resistance, and in response to the Israeli attacks on southern villages and civilian homes, the latest of which was the aggression that targeted the southern town of Aitaroun.
Earlier today, the resistance confirmed that it had targeted the ‚ÄúAfdoun‚Äù settlement, northern occupied Palestine, with ‚ÄúKatyusha‚Äù rockets, in support of Gaza and in response to the Israeli aggression on the town of Al-Dhaira, which led to the martyrdom of a citizen.
Related Articles: French Shift in Approach towards Lebanese Presidential File: Johnny Mounir discusses Franjieh's Declining Fortunes
The Islamic Resistance claimed responsibility for targeting a new headquarters for the Israeli military sector command in Liman with artillery shells, and announced that its mujahideen had targeted the Israeli ‚ÄúZaoura‚Äù camp.
In the face of the ongoing resistance operations, the correspondent of the Israeli Channel 13 in northern occupied Palestine acknowledged that this front has witnessed an increase in the level of ‚ÄúHezbollah attacks in recent days, whether with heavy weapons or using curved missiles or precision missiles, in addition to launching anti-armor missiles.‚Äù .
The reporter pointed out that Hezbollah is today using 180 and 220 mm missiles, and is trying to hit buildings with precision missiles.

author: AFP
title: UNESCO awards press prize to Palestinian journalists in Gaza - Breitbart
text: UNESCO on Thursday awarded its world press freedom prize to all Palestinian journalists covering the war in Gaza, where Israel has been battling Hamas for more than six months. ‚ÄúIn these times of darkness and hopelessness, we wish to share a strong message of solidarity and recognition to those Palestinian journalists who are covering this crisis in such dramatic circumstances,‚Äù said Mauricio Weibel, chair of the international jury of media professionals. ‚ÄúAs humanity, we have a huge debt to their courage and commitment to freedom of expression.‚Äù Audrey Azoulay, director general at the UN organisation for education, science and culture, said the prize paid ‚Äútribute to the courage of journalists facing difficult and dangerous circumstances‚Äù. According to the New York-based Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ), at least 97 members of the press have been killed since the war broke out in October, 92 of whom were Palestinians. The war started with Hamas‚Äôs unprecedented October 7 attack on Israel that resulted in the deaths of 1,170 people, mostly civilians, according to an AFP tally of Israeli official figures. Israel estimates that 129 captives seized by militants during their attack remain in Gaza. The military says 34 of them are dead. Israel‚Äôs retaliatory offensive against Hamas has killed at least 34,596 people in Gaza, mostly women and children, according to the Hamas-run territory‚Äôs health ministry.

title: La afici√≥n de Osasuna celebra el pase en San Mam√©s acord√°ndose del Athletic: "¬øD√≥nde est√° la Gabarra?"
text: La afici√≥n de Osasuna celebra el pase en San Mam√©s acord√°ndose del Athletic: "¬øD√≥nde est√° la Gabarra?" - Hasta 600 rojillos se desplazaron a San Mam√©s - El c√°ntico ya se escuch√≥ en la √∫ltima victoria copera de Osasuna en feudo rojiblanco - Patxi Pu√±al advierte al Athletic por los futuros fichajes desde Osasuna: "Pagar bien pagado" Athletic Club y Osasuna no defraudaron en el partido de este jueves correspondiente a los octavos de final de la Copa del Rey. En un encuentro loco, el cuadro rojillo volvi√≥ a asaltar San Mam√©s en el torneo del KO. Los leones, que peleaban por revalidar el t√≠tulo, se despidieron de su competici√≥n favorita ante los suyos. La fiesta, esta vez, se produjo en el sector visitante donde hasta 600 aficionados navarros arroparon a los de Vicente Moreno. Tras el pitido final de Mateo Busquets, √°rbitro principal del choque copero, toda la expedici√≥n rojilla se dirigi√≥ a la esquina de San Mam√©s donde se encontraban sus aficionados. La afici√≥n de Osasuna en San Mam√©s se acord√≥ del Athletic Tal y como ha recogido el periodista Daniel Arangay, la hinchada visitante se acord√≥ del Athletic Club una vez certificado su pase a los cuartos de final de la Copa del Rey. Los aficionados de Osasuna lanzaron c√°nticos en alusi√≥n a la Gabarra: "¬øD√≥nde est√° la Gabarra? ¬øLa Gabarra d√≥nde est√°?". üëÄLa afici√≥n de Osasuna tras eliminar al Athletic Club en San Mam√©s üó£Ô∏è‚Äù¬øD√≥nde est√° la Gabarra? ¬øLa Gabarra d√≥nde est√°?‚Äù [#Osasuna][#AthleticOsasuna][#CopaDelRey][pic.twitter.com/MztHBdBFiu]‚Äî Daniel Arangay (@DanielArangay) [January 16, 2025] El Athletic Club, tras caer ante Osasuna en San Mam√©s (2-3) en los octavos de final, ha roto una serie de 26 eliminatorias de Copa del Rey a partido √∫nico superadas de manera consecutiva en las √∫ltimas dos d√©cadas. La √∫ltima vez hasta este jueves en la que el equipo rojiblanco hab√≠a ca√≠do eliminado en este formato se remontaba a hace m√°s de 21 a√±os. Fue el 7 de octubre de 2003, en el campo c√°ntabro de El Malec√≥n, cuando el Athletic perdi√≥ por 2-1 frente a la Gimn√°stica de Torrelavega en la temporada del debut de Ernesto Valverde. Desde entonces, el conjunto bilba√≠no no hab√≠a sido eliminado en cruce directo en estos 20 a√±os en los que se hab√≠a medido a un rival de sexta categor√≠a, ocho de cuarta, seis de tercera, tres de segunda y ocho de primera. De ellas en tres ocasiones al Barcelona y en una a Real Madrid, Betis, Espanyol, Valencia y Deportivo Alav√©s.
